title: Managerial Leverage
summary: Maximize your impact by focusing on activities that multiply the output of your team.

details.content: Managerial leverage is about amplifying your effectiveness by investing time in activities that have the greatest positive effect on your team's results.
Instead of solving every problem yourself, train a team member to handle recurring issues, freeing up your time for higher-impact work.

content: Delegate tasks that others can do.
Spend time on training and coaching.
Focus on decisions and actions that influence many people.
Continuously assess where your time has the most leverage.

title: Task Prioritization
summary: Identify and focus on the most important tasks to maximize productivity and results.

details.content: Not all tasks are equally valuable. Prioritizing ensures that your time and energy are spent on what drives the most significant outcomes.
Choosing to address a critical customer issue before routine paperwork because it has a bigger impact on business success.

content: List your tasks and rank them by impact.
Use frameworks like the Eisenhower Matrix.
Review and adjust priorities regularly.
Say no to low-value activities.

title: Performance Measurement
summary: Track and evaluate results to ensure goals are met and improvements are made.

details.content: Measuring performance provides objective data to guide decisions, recognize achievements, and identify areas for growth.
Setting clear sales targets and reviewing weekly progress to identify trends and adjust strategies.

content: Define clear, measurable objectives.
Regularly review key metrics.
Give feedback based on data.
Adjust goals and processes as needed.

title: Decision-Making Processes
summary: Establish structured approaches to making effective and timely decisions.

details.content: A clear decision-making process reduces confusion, speeds up execution, and increases buy-in from your team.
Using a decision matrix to evaluate options and involve relevant stakeholders before choosing a new software tool.

content: Clarify who owns each decision.
Gather input from those affected.
Set deadlines for decisions.
Document and communicate decisions clearly.

title: Effective Meetings
summary: Run meetings that are purposeful, efficient, and result in clear outcomes.

details.content: Well-run meetings save time, align teams, and drive progress, while poorly run meetings waste resources and create confusion.
Starting meetings with a clear agenda and ending with actionable next steps.

content: Set and share an agenda in advance.
Start and end on time.
Assign roles (facilitator, note-taker).
Summarize decisions and action items.

title: Training and Development
summary: Invest in building your team's skills and capabilities for long-term success.

details.content: Continuous training ensures your team adapts to new challenges and maintains high performance.
Organizing regular workshops to upskill employees on new technologies relevant to your business.

content: Identify skill gaps through performance reviews.
Encourage knowledge sharing among team members.
Provide access to courses and learning resources.
Set development goals and track progress.

title: Feedback and Communication
summary: Foster open, timely, and constructive communication to improve performance and relationships.

details.content: Effective feedback and communication build trust, clarify expectations, and help individuals and teams grow.
Giving specific, actionable feedback after a project and inviting input from team members.

content: Give feedback promptly and respectfully.
Be specific and focus on behaviors, not personalities.
Encourage two-way communication.
Regularly check for understanding and alignment.
